content: The reality of applying AI at scale inside a mature engineering organization is far more complex and nuanced than simply using large language models (LLMs) to write code.

Integrating AI into the workflows of a large engineering organization (e.g., 9,000+ software engineers at Bloomberg) requires addressing the complexities and nuances beyond initial code generation capabilities.
The real return on investment (ROI) for AI in software engineering emerges once organizations move beyond 'toy examples' of code generation.
Successfully enabling AI across a large, established engineering organization requires implementing best practices, fostering cultural shifts, and establishing guardrails.
